message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the problem of multiple-node repair in distributed storage systems, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT) and distributed systems (cs.DS). The focus is on MDS codes, which are a type of error-correcting codes used in distributed storage systems, and the paper presents new explicit constructions of optimal MDS codes, which is a topic in coding theory (cs.CC). The paper also discusses the repair bandwidth under the cooperative model, which involves the amount of data exchanged between any two different storage nodes, and this is a topic in networking (cs.NI) and systems (cs.SI). Overall, the paper is likely to be classified under cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, and cs.NI, in that order of likelihood.
